p: Eilat virus (EILV) was isolated from a pool of An. coustani mosquitoes and displays inability to replicate in the vertebrate cellular environment [ 13, 43]. EILV was transmitted by bloodfeeding to An. gambiae, C. quinquefasciatus, and Ae. aegypti but not to Ae. albopictus , and may be vertically transmitted in the infected species, but the virus was not detected in the ovaries [ 13]. EILV did not display cytopathic effect in Aedes C6/36 and or C7/10 cells despite high replication at 12 h post infection. One proposed hypothesis is that EILV may have secondarily lost the ability to infect vertebrate cells, rather than being insect-specific as an ancestral character.
